title: 4 Easy Ways to Thaw Cool Whip to Perfection

steps.title: Take your Cool Whip out of the freezer and remove the lid.
steps.content: Take your Cool Whip out of the freezer and remove the lid. Full speed ahead! Take your Cool Whip out from your freezer and take off the lid to prepare for microwaving. Ensuring you’ve removed the lid will protect you from any unfortunate microwave explosions that would take longer to clean up than defrost! [1] X Research source

steps.title: Microwave your Cool Whip on defrost mode in 30-second intervals.
steps.content: Microwave your Cool Whip on defrost mode in 30-second intervals. Place your microwave on defrost mode, then put your Cool Whip in the microwave with the lid off. Hit the timer for 30 seconds and let it run before taking it out. [2] X Research source If your microwave doesn't have a defrost mode, setting it to low will work the same. The important thing here is that you don’t have your microwave on medium or high power, as your poor Cool Whip won’t stand a chance and will melt.

steps.title: Stir your Cool Whip every 30 seconds for 2-3 minutes or until thawed.
steps.content: Stir your Cool Whip every 30 seconds for 2-3 minutes or until thawed. Using a spoon or utensil, stir your Cool Whip as best you can and put it back in the microwave for another 30 seconds. Repeat the stirring and microwaving process in 30-second intervals until the Cool Whip is thawed and at the consistency of your liking—this should take around 2-3 minutes. [3] X Research source User beware, no one likes runny, yellow Cool Whip! To avoid a disaster, don’t be bold and microwave your Cool Whip for a solid 2-3 minutes—this will turn your dessert into soup. Once your Cool Whip is thawed, you won’t be able to refreeze it and try again if you mess up. When in doubt, err on the side of caution and underheat it—better too cold than liquidy. Cool Whip goes great with desserts like homemade sponge cake topped with strawberries!

steps.title: Fill a large bowl with cold water.
steps.content: Fill a large bowl with cold water. Grab a bowl large enough for your Cool Whip to float in and fill it nearly to the top with cold water. Don’t fill the bowl all the way up, as the water level will rise when you put in the Cool Whip container. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Take your Cool Whip out of the freezer and place it in the bowl.
steps.content: Take your Cool Whip out of the freezer and place it in the bowl. Remove your Cool Whip from the freezer and place it, lid on, into the bowl you’ve filled up with cold water. While some people are tempted to use lukewarm water to speed up the thawing process, cold water is the safest option because Cool Whip spoils easily as it’s a dairy product.

steps.title: Leave the Cool Whip to thaw in the bowl for 30-40 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the Cool Whip to thaw in the bowl for 30-40 minutes. Put on a tv show, move to the next thing on your to-do list, or zone out for 30-40 minutes—we won’t judge! After you’ve killed around 30 minutes, remove the Cool Whip from the bowl and check the consistency with a utensil. If it’s still too hard, let it thaw for another 10 minutes or more if necessary. You're all set to serve if the Cool Whip’s consistency suits your liking. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Take your Cool Whip from the freezer and set it on your countertop.
steps.content: Take your Cool Whip from the freezer and set it on your countertop. This method couldn’t be easier! Simply remove your Cool Whip from the freezer and set it on the countertop to thaw. Don’t take the lid off. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Leave out your Cool Whip to thaw for 1-2 hours.
steps.content: Leave out your Cool Whip to thaw for 1-2 hours. Set a timer for 1 hour and get back to whatever you were up to. When the timer goes off, open up your Cool Whip and give it a poke with a utensil to check whether it's at your preferred consistency. [7] X Research source Don’t leave your Cool Whip out for over 2 hours. Because Cool Whip is a dairy product, it can spoil easily. If you live in a hot climate, 1 hour will likely be all it takes to thaw, but 2 hours is more realistic if it's colder where you live.

steps.title: Let your Cool Whip thaw for an additional 1 hour if it’s still solid.
steps.content: Let your Cool Whip thaw for an additional 1 hour if it’s still solid. If, after 1 hour, your Cool Whip is still a little too solid for your liking, let it sit for another hour, checking it periodically (every 15 minutes or so) until it's thawed. Serve it immediately. [8] X Research source Don’t leave your Cool Whip out for longer than 2 hours—otherwise, it will spoil or be a runny consistency. You can even use Cool Whip to make a tasty homemade frosting.

steps.title: Take your Cool Whip from the freezer and place it in the refrigerator.
steps.content: Take your Cool Whip from the freezer and place it in the refrigerator. Time to remove your tasty treat from the freezer and switch it to the refrigerator. Remember to keep the lid on. [9] X Research source If you refrigerate the Cool Whip with its lid removed, it will thaw too rapidly, ruin the consistency, or even spoil.

steps.title: Let your Cool Whip thaw for 4-5 hours or overnight.
steps.content: Let your Cool Whip thaw for 4-5 hours or overnight. Let your Cool Whip hang out in your fridge for 4-5 hours or even overnight if you have the time. This is the best method to ensure your Cool Whip is the perfect consistency to eat. [10] X Research source Don’t be tempted to take your Cool Whip out of the fridge too early. For that perfectly fluffy, whipped consistency, 4-5 hours or overnight is key—it will still be partially frozen if you attempt to remove it anytime sooner.

steps.title: Remove your Cool Whip from the refrigerator and serve it immediately.
steps.content: Remove your Cool Whip from the refrigerator and serve it immediately. Take your Cool Whip out of the refrigerator, and use a utensil to check if it's at the right consistency. If it's to your liking, it’s time to eat and enjoy! [11] X Research source For a delicious treat, try serving Cool Whip on top of fruit or homemade ice cream .
